general_advisory: In view of above five days weather forecast received from IMD, farmers are advised to carry out weeding, fertilization, irrigation, harvesting, and application of plant protection chemicals as needed. Farmers are advised to transplant 30-45 days old vegetable seedlings like chilli, tomato, capsicum, cabbage, cauliflower, brinjal, etc. in the main field. Rouging of viral infested crop should be done in chilli, tomato & brinjal. Infected plants should be uprooted and buried in the soil. Now is the suitable time for sowing mustard, sarson, sunflower, field pea, carrot, radish, etc. So, farmers are advised to act accordingly. Pulses like lentil/black gram/green gram can be broadcasted in the standing matured crop (Rice) one week before harvesting to utilize the residual moisture in the soil in suitable areas. Apply 20-25 kg DAP + 10 kg MoP per acre as basal before sowing Mustard.

advisory: In early maturing varieties, harvest the crop when 80-85% of the grains are matured either manually by sickle or by using combine harvester or reaper.
Picking should be done when there is complete bursting of bolls.
Dry the seed cotton on concrete floor or tarpaulin sheets to reduce the moisture to 8-10%. Store the seed cotton obtained from the 1st picking separately for getting a better price.
Foliar spray of liquid fertilizers like NPK-19-19-19 should be done @ 20 g/10 liters of water for better plant growth and boll development
Regular monitoring of the crop to know about the incidence of any new pest and diseases.
Sowing should be completed by the first fortnight of November. Treat the seed with Thiram @ 2.5g/kg or Bavistin @ 2g/kg seed before sowing.
Seed rate for Mustard 2.5-3 kg/acre and 1.5-2.0 kg/acre are for Toria.
Suitable variety: Mustard -Pusa bold, Pusa Jaikisan, JD-6. Toria - M 29, Anuradha, Parbati.
Nutrient Management: Apply 20-25 kg DAP + 10 kg MoP per acre as basal and 35-40 kg Urea + 5 kg MoP/acre before the 1st irrigation.
Sowing should be completed by Mid-November. Treat the seed with Vitavax power (Carboxin+Thiram) @ 2.5g/kg or Metalaxyl @ 5g/kg seed before sowing.
Suitable variety: Inbred -Modern, TNAUSUF-7, DRSF-108 (90 days), Hybrid -PAC 36, KBSH 1, MSFH 8, MSFH 17 (95-110 days)

For monitoring of borer insect, farmers are advised to use pheromone trap @ 8/acre. To control chemically, spray Spinosad 45% SC @ 1.5 ml/4 liters of water or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 4g/10 ltr of water or Thiodicarb 75% WP @ 2ml/ltr of water.
Infestation of thrips has been noticed. Plants are affected by thrips if leaves curl upward.

To manage thrips infestation install Blue sticky trap @ 8 nos./acre. For chemical control spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/lit or Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/lit or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL 0.35 ml/lit of water.

Deworm the cattle and buffalo at regular intervals and vaccinate them also. If the animal is not coming to heat even after 4 years, consult with the veterinary doctors and follow the doctor's advice for the onset of puberty.
Regularly check animals for signs of dehydration, heat stress, and parasitic infections. Deworm animals as needed and vaccinate them against common diseases such as foot-and-mouth disease, PPR.

Raised platforms and deep litter systems in poultry houses help in maintaining cleanliness and temperature control. Regularly clean and disinfect the house to prevent the buildup of pathogens in the high-humidity conditions after rain. Maintain appropriate stocking density to reduce stress and prevent overheating.
